quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: John Mccain Iii and George Washington
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, john, college. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Throughout the American War for Independence, Martha Washington traveled with her husband George Washington a majority of the time and was close by.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In 1987, John McCain III assumed office as a Senator from this state.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arizona

questions.question: After the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor, Franklin D. Roosevelt went before Congress to call for a declaration of war on Japan. What was his memorable phrase for the day of the attack?

options.text: day of the Jap sneak attack
date that will live in infamy

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: date that will live in infamy

questions.question: What college did John McCain III attend?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: United States Naval Academy

questions.question: What branch of service did John McCain III serve in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Navy

questions.question: This person helped Franklin D. Roosevelt by mixing with the US people and relaying their ideas and feelings to the president.

options.text: his secretary of state Cordell Hull

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: his wife Eleanor Roosevelt

questions.question: John McCain III cant comb his hair.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of the following were most likely to dislike and oppose Franklin D. Roosevelt?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: wealthy people

questions.question: Where did George Washington and his troops enter winter quarters after Trenton and Princeton in early 1777?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Morristown

questions.question: During the Revolutionary War, George Washington sent armed schooners to prey on enemy shipping for supplies.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: FDR favored helping Britain in its fight with Germany after 1939. However, he was limited in ability to send military equipment to Britain because of strong opposition. Which of the following most strongly influenced FDR to go slow on aid to Britain?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: isolationists

questions.question: What happened to John McCain III while serving in Vietnam?

options.text: He became a prisoner of war.
He won the Medal of Honor.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He became a prisoner of war.

questions.question: Roosevelt was very effective in communicating with the American people by radio. What did he call his best known radio broadcasts to the American people?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fireside Chats

questions.question: What year was John McCain III born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1936

questions.question: Which statement is true about FDR?

options.text: He was the first US President to die of natural causes while in office.
He was the first US President to be elected for four presidential terms.
He was the first US President to act as commander-in-chief of the armed forces during wartime.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was the first US President to be elected for four presidential terms.

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Jesse James and Fidel Castro

questions.question: Did Robert Wagner play Jesse in the 1957 movie The True Story of Jesse James?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: What aircraft did John McCain III fly while in the military?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A-4 Skyhawk

questions.question: Who played Jesse James in the 1966 horror fantasy movie Jesse James Meets Frankensteins Daughter?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Lupton

questions.question: What is Fidel Castros astrological sign?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leo

questions.question: Who portrayed Jesse James in the 2007 movie The Assassination of Jesse James by the Coward Bob Ford?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brad Pitt

questions.question: In 2008, this newspaper reported on John McCains relationship with a lobbyist in Washington?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New York Times

questions.question: Cuban political leader Fidel Castro has three sisters. Two of them are named Juanita and Emma. What is the name of the third one?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Angela

questions.question: In 1945, Fidel Castro entered the University of Havana to study what major subject?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Law

questions.question: How many medals did John McCain III receive while in the military?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 5

questions.question: Which statement is true?

options.text: At age 37 Tom Monaghan founds the Dominos Pizza chain.
At age 37 Franz Kafka publishes The Metamorphosis.
At age 37 King James commissions a translation of the Bible.
At age 37 Emperor Nero fiddles while Rome burns.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: At age 37 King James commissions a translation of the Bible.

questions.question: When Fidel Castro was a teenager, he chose the middle name Alejandro referring to which historical figure?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alexander the Great

questions.question: Which Southeastern state primary was crucial in the 2000 election battle between George W. Bush and John McCain?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: South Carolina

questions.question: Who played Jesse James in the1939 film Jesse James at Bay?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roy Rogers

questions.question: In 624, this priestess led the Arabian Quraish against Muhammad.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hind - Al - Hunnud

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Praised

options.text: May Yahweh add to his years

May Yahweh illuminate his way through the darkness

questions.question: What does the Hebrew name Gabriel mean?

questions.question: What is the meaning of the name Solomon?

questions.question: What is the name of Fidel Castros second wife, mother of five of his sons?

options.text: Successfully tested a nuclear weapon underground

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Steve Jobs and Neil Armstrong
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, people, steve. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Neil Armstrong first flew into space in 1966 as the command pilot of this mission.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gemini 8

questions.question: What company was Steve Jobs fired from in 1985?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Apple

questions.question: What computer engineer and programmer co-founded Apple together with Steve Jobs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Steve Wozniak

questions.question: Which crewman of Apollo 11 had made a spaceflight before the Apollo 11 mission?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What was the name given by Neil Armstrong to the landing site on the moon where the Apollo 11 Lunar Module made the first moon landing?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tranquility Base

questions.question: Which of these films was NOT produced by Pixar, the company Steve Jobs acquired in 1986?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Princess and the Frog

questions.question: In his non-fiction book The Right Stuff, this best-selling author and journalist introduced Neil Armstrong with the words, A lot of people couldnt figure out Armstrong.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tom Wolfe

questions.question: What religion did Steve Jobs adopt in the mid-1970s?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Buddhism

questions.question: In what war had Neil Armstrong served before becoming an astronaut?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Korean War

questions.question: In 1947, Neil Armstrong began studying aerospace engineering at this university, where he was a member of Phi Delta Theta and Kappa Kappa Psi.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Purdue University

questions.question: Which of these was Steve Jobs mantra that he borrowed from the Whole Earth Catalog?

options.text: Infinite Creative energy in manifestation and activity.
The creator of all is One. Truth is His name.
The ecstasy of consciousness is my beloved.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stay hungry, stay foolish.

questions.question: What famous dystopian English novel inspired the television commercial that introduced the Apple Macintosh personal computer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nineteen Eighty-Four

questions.question: Where did Steve Jobs study for one semester following his high school graduation?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Reed College

questions.question: Who did Steve Jobs refer to when saying, Hed be a broader guy if he had dropped acid once or gone off to an ashram when he was younger.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bill Gates

questions.question: In 1972, Neil Armstrong was welcomed in this country where his ancestors were born.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Scotland

questions.question: Find the incorrect statement regarding Joe Biden.

Joe Biden has cast over 10,000 votes in Congress.

questions.question: What Governor appointed Major George Washington to lead a mostly diplomatic party to the Ohio Valley to confront the French?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dinwiddie

questions.question: In 2008, Quincy Jones presented Neil Armstrong and Senator John Glenn with platinum copies of this popular moon song.

options.text: The Dark Side of the Moon

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Delaware

options.text: She died in a car crash.
She died in an airplane crash.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False
